comments: The best prof./teacher I\'ve ever had. I\'m severely going to miss him as he said he was retiring this year, I wish I had more opportunities to have him as a professor. Every class was inspirational, he just had such a way with words and teaching and every story he assigned was amazing. I actually found the homework and project and exams to be fun.

comments: Amazing professor. He quizzes on the most tiniest details in the reading, so you have to read SUPER carefully and remember everything word for word. His essays were easy and surprisingly fun to write. He lets you revise 3 essays for a grade higher. His research paper on Heart of Darkness by Joseph Conrad was a pain, but really interesting novel.

comments: Professor Watts is the best professor I have ever had. He is kind and very forgiving if you mess up an assignment. He is a very easy grader, and does not give a lot of homework, but if you just do it, you will get an A no problem. I am already signed up for his English 2 class.

comments: Very clear instructions, great reading assignments, super helpful, funny. What I enjoyed most is he emphasizes whats important and does not stress the small stuff. Excellent teacher and nice person.

tag_professor: Clear grading criteria (7)  Get ready to read (6)  Gives good feedback (5)  Amazing lectures (2)  Inspirational (2)  Caring (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Respected (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: For his English 2 class, you basically read a chapter or so and write a summary about it, super easy. We had 3 essays + a group project + final exam was an essay on the poems. Don\'t be late, he hates that & will put you on the spot. Overall a great professor, I\'ll miss his class.

stu_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES  GET READY TO READ
comments: Best Professor Ever! He is chill, nice, funny and pretty easy. In the beginning it\'s a lot reading and pop quizzes (every day and make sure to get there early because he starts right away and will not repeat the questions). Do not procrastinate on your research paper! There are about four to five essays. Good Luck! Take him!

comments: Professor Watts made a good impression on me from the beginning with his daily recitation of poetry. Essays are my least favorite thing, but were worth the effort. There are daily quizzes based on assigned readings and six essays in total, which include both the research paper and final. Lenient grader.

comments: Although, Professor Watts is passionate and a great literature instructor, he\'s kind of a dbag. When approached, after class, about questions on projects, he responds with vague and ambiguous answers and doesn\'t put much input. He\'s a very knowledgeable man and, again, very passionate, but I wouldn\'t describe him as kind, generous, or helpful.

comments: Took professor Watts over the summer.. He is great!!! Take him.. He is very cool and easy to approach for help... Not easy nor hard! Just attend class read and do a couple of essays which are easy to figure out... Must take!

comments: I took this class over the summer and so it was a little intense at first. A lot of reading, but professor Watts is by far the best English teacher I ever had. I appreciate literature a lot more than I used to. If you can take him, do it.

tag_professor: Clear grading criteria (7)  Get ready to read (6)  Gives good feedback (5)  Amazing lectures (2)  Inspirational (2)  Caring (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Respected (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Without a doubt one of the best professors at SMC. He is caring, nice and helpful. I strongly recommend but only if you are a serious student. If not then stay away.

tag_professor: Clear grading criteria (7)  Get ready to read (6)  Gives good feedback (5)  Amazing lectures (2)  Inspirational (2)  Caring (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Respected (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: Prof. Watts is old fashioned but he is a very kind man and "helpful" doesn\'t do him justice. Do the readings every night and come to class ON TIME every day as he starts the quizzes right away. He gives you 3-4 essays and allows you to revise them for a higher grade later on. The research paper is tough so start it ASAP. He lets you out early too!
